ACCOUNTANT

SUMMARY

Experienced, highly motivated work ethic, with results-driven professionalism, recognized for commitment to excellence, and demonstrates expertise in communicating and collaborating with, peers, and clients.
Portrays excellent business acumen, and successfully provide accurate Accounts Receivables, Collections and Accounts Payable initiatives that achieves targeted company goals.
Self-motivated professional, able to work independently or in a team environment, demonstrating broad based and transferable qualifications.

Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Windows computer systems and Mac operating system.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point).
Basic experience with QuickBooks Enterprise Solutions 9.0, Sage/MAS Software, Peachtree, and Microsoft Access.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Appraisal Coordinator

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, General Business, Quality Assurance

Description:
Genesis Capital (the “Company”) is one of the largest business purpose lenders in the country, focused on providing commercial real estate financing solutions to real estate developers who buy, renovate, and sell single-family and/or multi-family residential real estate. The Company is a subsidiary of Rithm Capital (parent company), a publicly traded mortgage real estate investment trust.

The Appraisal Coordinator II is responsible for coordinating and reviewing required appraisal documents during loan transaction process, managing, updating all critical appraisal information, and following up on document requests. Work will be transacted in a fast-paced environment. The position assumes a high degree of accountability. Attention to detail is critical.
Principal Duties:Works with originations team and loan processors to ensure that all required documents are received and reviewed for accuracy so that the appraisal is ordered/processed in a timely mannerEngage and coordinate 3rd party vendors for such items as appraisals, property valuations, property profiles.Review completed 3rd party reports, providing summaries and comments highlighting any potential issues to the appropriate lead.Manage document flow between appraisers, valuations, loan processors, loan originators, underwriters.Update and management of loan pipeline.Document and communicate all changes to the loan transaction to ensure information is updatedMonitor, identify variance in IV (Internal Valuation), and appraisalOther duties may be assigned. 
Education and ExperienceHigh School Diploma or GED, required.Bachelor’s degree in business or related area preferred.2-5 years’ relevant experience, specifically in due diligence and transaction in mortgage loans, preferably mortgage or banking related industry.
Knowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesMust be a highly organized individual with the ability to multi-task, work successfully under pressure, and effectively manage time and workload.Proficiency in all Microsoft Office products.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.A true self-starter capable of accomplishing complicated tasks with limited supervision.Self-motivated with strong desire to succeed.Strong interpersonal and communication skills with exceptional follow-through abilitiesStrong business acumen.Takes initiative with a clear business purpose in mind.Continually seeks to improve business processes.Adapts to change easily in a fast-working environment.Follows direction easily.
While this description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position’s requirements, it in no way implies/states that these are the only job responsibilities. Management reserves the right to modify, add or remove duties and request other duties, as necessary. 
By applying to this position, the candidate acknowledges that this is not a remote role and is required to be on-site.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
